Hi Superpath team :wave:

Our agency had a nice feature on TechCrunch today. Pretty chuffed. Shamelessly plugging here as well:

<https://techcrunch.com/2021/07/28/unmuted-founder-max-van-den-ingh-on-success-beyond-the-metrics/>

attachments.title: Unmuted founder Max van den Ingh on success beyond the metrics – TechCrunch
attachments.text: "You have to understand that working at a startup often feels like you’re standing on the edge of a cliff. And that’s also the moment you’re at your most creative."

elements.text: Our agency had a nice feature on TechCrunch today. Pretty chuffed. Shamelessly plugging here as well:

text:
Hey! I'm Erin, and I'm a marketing director at The Predictive Index.

Over the past three years, my team and I have generated MILLIONS of dollars in revenue by publishing the kind of research reports people actually want to read and share.

And now I'm packing everything I know about research report creation into a course. For you. Because I like you, yo. :two_hearts:

My course, *The Research Report Playbook: Here We Grow, Yo*, is now available for pre-order. :partying_face:

In it, *I take you step-by-step through the EXACT playbook I use to create research reports* ... like the 2020 Remote Work Report, which has generated $490,000+ in revenue (so far).

Learn more or pre-order here! <https://bit.ly/3f3C63R>

attachments.title: The Research Report Playbook: Here We Grow, Yo
attachments.text: Hey! I'm Erin, and I'm a marketing director at The Predictive Index. Over the past three years, my team and I have generated MILLIONS of dollars in revenue by publishing the kind of research reports people actually want to read and share. And now I'm packing everything I know about research report creation into a course. For you. Because I like you, yo. I'll take you step-by-step through the EXACT playbook I use to create research reports ... like the 2020 Remote Work Report, which has generated $490,000+ in revenue (so far). I'll also answer all your burning questions: How do I get valid data? What if the data doesn't support the story I want to tell? Am I supposed to gate the report for lead gen? How do I project manage all the moving parts? Why is my butt itchy? (Well on second thought, not ALL of your burning questions.) If you know me from my LinkedIn posts, you know my content has an edge to it. So expect some sarcasm, and maybe a swear or two. And expect to walk away with the knowledge and confidence you need to start creating your own research reports. Course PreviewPart 1: Course IntroIntro, objectives, and outlineThe future of B2B content marketingPart 2: Research + PlanningDelegation and outsourcingIdentifying your ideal storylineCampaign management KPIsKickoffPart 3: Data Collection + analysisProprietary data vs. survey dataChoosing a vendorBuilding the surveyData sciencePart 4: Creating the surveyStorytelling tipsHTML vs. PDFGraphic designLaunchPart 5: Distribution and promotionSales enablementOrganic distributionPaid distributionPart 6: IterationPost mortemProcess improvementsGetting better results over timePart 7: Monetization (Bonus)How to sell research reports to clientsFAQsWho’s this course for?In-house B2B content marketers who want to produce REAL business results. Freelance content writers who want to add a high-ticket item to their service menu. What’s in it for me?Content marketers who can strategize, project manage, and write research reports are incredibly valuable to B2B companies. That’s because—if well-executed—research reports equal dolla dolla bills. And trust, you wanna be the person bringing in dolla dolla bills. That person gets internal promotions, client referrals, and a fat bank account.Why should I listen to you?I’ve been leading content teams for 6.5 years now, first at a Boston-based content marketing agency, and now at a high-growth B2B SaaS company. As head of content, I helped launch a market category to land a $50M Series A. We use research reports not only to grow category awareness and adoption—but also to grow the company. My insights have been featured by the American Marketing Association, Content Marketing Institute, and the American Society of Journalists and Authors. I've written for many B2B SaaS companies including HubSpot, Drift, G2, Intuit, Greenhouse, and Metadata.io.What will I learn in this course?You’ll learn how to create a marketing research report for B2B companies. You’ll learn to improve your process over time, based on data and learnings. And if you’re a freelance content marketing writer, you’ll also learn how to sell this high-ticket offer to clients.How much does it cost?For a limited time, you can pre-order the course for $109. After September 7, the price will increase to $150. That may seem pricey at first glance. But when you’re creating reports that generate hundreds of thousands of dollars, it’s pretty easy to negotiate a six-figure salary. And when you have proof that you deliver results, clients are more likely to sign that $10,000+ freelance contract.How long will it take to see results?If you need to deliver immediate leads to your sales team (like many of us do), you can start doing that on day one. If you follow my distribution advice, you could get ongoing results—leads and revenue—for a whole year or more! Can I create research reports on my own?To execute a research report according to my playbook, you need several skill sets working together: data analysis, writing, graphic design, web dev, and distribution. If you're a unicorn, you can create reports on your own. If you're a content marketer or writer, you can execute several pieces of the pie (e.g., project management, survey building, report writing, ad copy), and delegate or outsource the rest, depending on if you're in-house or freelance. Don’t worry, my course covers delegation and outsourcing.I’m in. Where do I sign up?Cool! Click the “I want this!” button to pre-order the course. I’ll email it to you on September 7, along with a smidgen of my undying love.
attachments.fallback: Gumroad: The Research Report Playbook: Here We Grow, Yo

text:
:memo: Do you wonder how other organizations are managing their freelance writers? How do your project management flows compare to others?

Join us for Clearscope's next webinar on "*Common Mistakes When Working With Freelance Writers*" with Vin D'Eletto, owner at WordAgents. The webinar will cover Vin's learnings from delivering over 77 million words in SEO content to 2700+ WordAgents' clients. You will learn why you need written agreements and statements of work to provide clarity to everyone involved, how to look for the right skills in freelance writers, and much more!

:spiral_note_pad: *Details:*
** Title:* Common Mistakes When Working With Freelance Writers
** Speakers:* <@U01SMSTUWKY>, Owner at <https://wordagents.com/|WordAgents>
** Date & time:* Thursday, August 5th, 11:00 AM US Central Time
** Zoom registration page:* <https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/3616274984649/WN_KOCbpYL0SSC-IlLKFcdFIA>
** Who should attend:* Attend this webinar for insights on managing a team of freelance writers. We'll cover best practices including project management tips and how to set the right expectations.

RSVP to attend live OR receive the webinar recording in your inbox if you can't make it :inbox_tray:
